title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

A correct numerical answer without supporting work does not earn this point.

The point is earned for a correct numerical difference in a correct quotient. The difference in the numerator must be shown either as g ′  ( 6 )− g ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DDC@ or as − 4−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E9@

The values of g ′  ( 6 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3823@ and g ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@381D@ must be pulled from the table; g ′  ( 6 )− g ′  ( 0 ) 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaabaaaaaaaaape Gabm4zayaafaGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGOnaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiab gkHiTiqadEgagaqbaiaayIW7daqadaqaaiaaicdaaiaawIcacaGLPa aaa8aabaGaaGOnaaaaaaa@3EBD@ does not yet earn the point.

The answer does not need to be simplified but if simplified, it must be correct to earn the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

First point:

The first point is earned for stating that g has points of inflection at both x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaaaa@35F0@ and x=3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maiaac6caaaa@36A3@ No reasoning is needed to earn this point. Note that:

· Endpoints or points outside the interval 0<x<6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaiAdaaaa@37B0@ do not affect the scoring. Reponses are not penalized for inclusion and discussion of points outside of the interval.

· If any other internal points are identified as points of inflection or if only one point of inflection is given, the first point is not earned.

· If g ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@37F3@ and/or g ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaG4maaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@37F4@ are given as the points of inflection, the response does not earn the first point but is eligible for the second point.

· If ordered pairs are presented, they must be correct to earn the first point. That is, the ordered pairs must be ( 2,  g ( 2 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFE@ and ( 3,  g ( 3 ) ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB0@ or equivalently ( 2,  4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39FB@ and ( 3,  6 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AAF@

· Set notation may be used: { 2,  3 } MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA1@ should be read as “the set containing x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaaaa@35F0@ and x=3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maiaac6caaaa@36A3@ ” Using any other notation such as [ 2,  3 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A62@ does not earn the first point.

· Just writing 2,  3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaiilaiaaykW7caaMc8UaaG4maaaa@3871@ does not earn the point. The response must indicate that these are x-values.

Second point:

The second point is earned for the justification of both x=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@35F1@ and x=4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGinaiaac6caaaa@36A4@ The justification must state that g ″ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga GbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@36D2@ changes sign at these places to earn the point.

The justification does not have to specify the direction of the sign change at either point. However, if the response reports the wrong direction of the sign change in g ″ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgaga GbamaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@36D2@ at either point, this point is not earned.

Special case: If a response presents one of the two correct points of inflection (and presents no other points) with a correct justification, then the response will earn one of the two points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

First point:

The first point is earned for the setup of a right Riemann sum. The minimum requirement is that we must see the sum of a product of a height and a width for each of the three rectangles. The width of 1 can be implied and does not need to be shown.

The first point is earned if there is at most one error in the six factors of the terms of the sum g ( 2 )( 2−0 )+g ( 3 )( 3−2 )+g ( 4 )( 4−3 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4FBC@

Responses that start with numerical values are eligible to earn the first point. For example, the following responses earn the first point:

· 4 ⋅ 2+6 ⋅ 2+8 ⋅ 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49F2@

· 4 ⋅ 2+6+8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D75@

· a ⋅ 2+6+8, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4D@ where a≠4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadggacqGHGjsUcaaI0aaaaa@36BC@

· 4 ⋅ b+6+8, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E50@ where b≠2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadkgacqGHGjsUcaaIYaaaaa@36BB@

In contrast, a response that only shows 8+6+8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI4aGaey4kaSIaaGOnaiabgUcaRiaaiIdaaaa@3739@ or 22 does not earn the first point.

Second point:

Only responses that earn the first point are eligible to earn the second point.

The second point is earned only for the correct answer (22). The answer does not need to be simplified, but if simplified, it must be correct to earn the second point.

Equating the actual value of the integral with the approximation will not result in a loss of a point.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Note: Responses in part (d) must include a conclusion with reasoning to be eligible for points. A correct conclusion without reasoning earns no points.

First point:

The first point is earned for reasoning that g is increasing over the given interval.

To earn the first point the response must state g ′  ( x )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A22@ or g ′  ( x )≥0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B92@ For clarification:

· Stating g is increasing, without stating g ′  ( x )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A22@ or g ′  ( x )≥0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B90@ does not earn the first point.

· Stating g ′  ( x )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A22@ or g ′  ( x )≥0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B90@ without stating that g is increasing, earns the first point.

A picture, graph, or sign chart must be accompanied by a verbal explanation that g ′  ( x )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A22@ or g ′  ( x )≥0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE0@ in order to be relevant. Without a verbal explanation, a picture, graph, or sign chart does not earn either point.

Use of pronouns such as “it” or the “curve” are ambiguous and will not earn the point unless they are clearly tied to a correct use of a word such as derivative, slope of g, g ′ , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgagaqbaiaacYcaaaa@34F9@ or g. Note that the word “function” will be read as meaning the function g.

Intervals are not required to earn the first point. If intervals are presented, they must be 0<x<2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaikdaaaa@37AC@ and 2<x<4, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaisdacaGGSaaaaa@3860@ or 0<x<4, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaisdacaGGSaaaaa@385E@ with or without endpoints included.

Second point:

The second point is earned for reasoning and a correct conclusion.

Eligibility: The response must state either that g ′  ( x )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A22@ or that g is increasing.

Special case: If a response includes g ′  ( x )>0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AD2@ reports that g was decreasing, and concludes that the right Riemann sum approximation is an underestimate, the response earns the second point, but not the first point.

The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The first point is earned for using integration by parts and presenting an expression in x. Limits of integration are not considered for the first point. Responses with correct, incorrect, or no limits are eligible to earn the first point. A single sign error between the two terms will still earn this point, but will not earn the third (answer) point. Responses that would earn the first point include:

· x  g ′  ( x )  |  0  3 − ∫ 0 3 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@51D4@

· x  g ′  ( x )  |  0  3 + ∫ 0 3 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@51C9@

· x  g ′  ( x )− ∫ g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4796@

· x  g ′  ( x )+ ∫ g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@478B@

· x  g ′  ( x )±g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41D9@

Any mixture of indefinite and definite integrals in these expressions will also earn the first point.

Second point:

Responses are eligible for the second point even if they did not earn the first point. The second point is earned for correctly using the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus to conclude that ∫ 0 3 g ′  ( x )  dx =g ( 3 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CD9@ or ∫ 0 3 g ′  ( x )  dx =6−1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4583@

Note that it is not required to have the remaining terms from the integration by parts present or correct to earn this point.

A response that begins with a correct presentation of all terms resulting from evaluation of the integral by integration by parts will earn the integration by parts point and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point. Note that the term 0 ⋅  g ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3B@ must be present.

Responses that begin with:

· 3 ⋅  g ′  ( 3 )−0 ⋅  g ′  ( 0 )−( g ( 3 )−g ( 0 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@571D@ earns the first two points.

· 3 ⋅  g ′  ( 3 )−0−( g ( 3 )−g ( 0 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CCE@ earns the first two points.

· 3 ⋅  g ′  ( 3 )−( g ( 3 )−g ( 0 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B27@ does not earn the first point, but does earn the second point.

· 3 ⋅  g ′  ( 3 )−0 ⋅  g ′  ( 0 )−( g ( 3 )+g ( 0 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5731@ earns the first point, but does not earn the second point.

Third point:

The third point is earned only for the correct answer (7). Simplifying the arithmetic is not needed but if presented, must be correct to earn the third point.

Responses that include a “ + C MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHRaWkcaaMe8Uaam4qaaaa@3669@ ” on a definite integral are eligible for the first and second points (integration by parts and FTC) but cannot earn the answer point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned for the correct answer. No work needs to be shown. Simplifications of the coefficients if presented, must be correct to earn the point.

A response with additional terms beyond the quadratic term or an ellipsis ( + ⋯ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHRaWkcaaMe8UaeS47IWeaaa@378E@ ) at the end of the expression will not earn this point.

Equating g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3854@ with the polynomial is acceptable for this point.

Responses that present 8− ( x−4 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A1A@ and then go on to expand the polynomial to 8−16+8x+ x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE4@ or −8+8x+ x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A69@ will earn the point unless the expanded form is declared as the final answer by circling or boxing.
